alert.note: Alert for East Cameron; Lower Iberia; Lower Vermilion; Upper Iberia; Upper Vermilion; West Cameron (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Lake Charles (Southeast Texas and Southwest Louisiana)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued January 23 at 1:42PM CST until further notice by NWS Lake Charles
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT FROM 6 PM CST THIS EVENING THROUGH THURSDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...Portions of Louisiana, including the following parishes, East Cameron, Lower Iberia, Lower Vermilion, Upper Iberia, Upper Vermilion and West Cameron and southeast Texas, including the following areas, Lower Jefferson, Northern Orange, Southern Orange and Upper Jefferson. * WHEN...From 6 PM CST this evening through Thursday morning. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Flooding may occur in poor drainage and urban areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Widespread showers and thunderstorms are expected to develop over the next couple of days. Some of these storms will produce heavy rainfall. 4 to 8 inches of rain on average is expected with locally higher amounts. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.

area.areaDesc: East Cameron; Lower Iberia; Lower Vermilion; Upper Iberia; Upper Vermilion; West Cameron
